{{infobox military conflict |conflict =Battle of Mek'ele |partof =the [[First Italo-Ethiopian War]] |image = Mekele 1896.jpg |image_size = 300px |caption = The fort at Mek'ele after the siege |date =January 1896 |place =[[Mek'ele]], [[Ethiopia]] |coordinates = |map_type = |map_relief = |latitude = |longitude = |map_size = |map_marksize = |map_caption = |map_label = |territory = |result =Ethiopian victory |status = |combatant1 =[[File:Flag of Italy (1861-1946).svg|27px]] [[Kingdom of Italy]] |combatant2 =[[File:Flag of Ethiopia (1897-1936; 1941-1974).svg|27px]] [[Ethiopian Empire]] |commander1 =[[Giuseppe Galliano]] |commander2 =[[Ras Makonnen]] |units1 = |units2 = |strength1 =1,183
''1,000 [[Askari]] and 183 Italians'' |strength2 =Unknown |casualties1 =Unknown |casualties2 =costly assaults {{cite book|title=Armies of the Adowa Campaign 1896 |first=Sean |last=McLachlan |year=2011 |pp= 12|place=Colchester}} |notes = |campaignbox ={{Campaignbox First Italo-Ethiopian War}} }} The '''Battle of Mek'ele''', sometimes known as the '''siege of Mek'ele''', took place in January 1896 during the [[First Italo-Ethiopian War]]. Italian forces surrendered a partially completed fort at [[Mek'ele]], a city in the northern [[Tigray Region]] of [[Ethiopia]] which they had occupied since 1895, to Ethiopian forces. The Italians numbered by 20 officers, 13 [[non-commissioned officer]]s, and 150 in the ranks, supported by 1,000 [[Askari]] and two mountain guns. After two weeks of bombardment by Ethiopian artillery - which possessed a longer reach than that of the Italians - the Ethiopians managed to cut off the fort's water supply, prompting the defenders surrender. ==References== ;Notes {{reflist}} ;Written sources * {{cite book | title=Armies of the Adowa Campaign 1896: The Italian Disaster in Ethiopia | publisher=Osprey Publishing | author=McLachlan, Sean | year=2011 | isbn=1849089388}} {{coord missing|Ethiopia}} [[Category:Conflicts in 1896|Mek'ele]] [[Category:Battles of the First Italo-Ethiopian War|Mek'ele]] [[Category:1896 in Ethiopia]] [[Category:Battles involving Italy|Mek'ele]] [[Category:Battles involving Ethiopia|Mek'ele]] [[Category:History of Eritrea]] [[Category:History of Ethiopia]] [[Category:Military history of Ethiopia|Mek'ele]] [[Category:Military history of Eritrea|Mek'ele]]
